description:
Located in Northwest Indiana to include Gary and Portage, the Plant Process Control Intern position at United States Steel Corporation affords the opportunity to apply educational experiences to real world industrial applications.

This assignment is for CURRENT STUDENTS looking for a paid internship that offers personal and professional development. We are looking for motivated self-starters that can work in a fast paced, data-driven environment.
The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion for process improvement.

Experiences are offered that encompass both existing system maintenance/enhancements, as well as ground up design, development and installation of new systems and processes, focused on productivity and quality improvements. Strong mentoring by seasoned Control Engineers ensures a mutually beneficial work experience.

Experience gained may include, but is not limited to the following:

  • Accurately design, develop and implement programs and systems to meet identified current and future business needs in accordance with current software development standards and standard operating procedures

  • Refine and maintain system software used to control process equipment and by modifying existing programs

  • Analyze and diagnose computer malfunctions and perform necessary corrective measures to efficiently return equipment and/or machinery to operational state that satisfies management objectives

  • Monitor and conduct necessary tests to assure digital systems are functioning properly

  • Collaborate with supervisors, operating personnel, and other maintenance personnel regarding system maintenance issues, as well as system enhancement requests

  • Perform specialized analysis and prepare written reports regarding test results and malfunctions encountered with equipment, offering recommendations for improvements

Requirements:

Candidates must be a full-time student pursuing a bachelor or master’s degree majoring in one of the following: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology, Electrical Engineering, or other IT/Engineering-related discipline.

  • Candidates must be a current student
  • Completed their sophomore year by December 2020
  • Be in good academic standing
  • Be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship
  • Must attach a recent transcript and any other related information to your application.
  • May roll into a year-round internship for the successful candidate

Requisition Type

US-Non-Exempt

Company Overview

Steel is essential to advancing modern society. In fact, countless aspects of our lives wouldn’t be possible without it. From state-of-the-art household appliances and safer, more fuel-efficient automobiles — to steel framing that makes our homes stronger and tubular products that support the development of our nation’s energy resources — our products build quality of life for people around the world. U. S. Steel is on an exciting transformational journey to become the iconic corporation — a company set apart from the competition through the talent of our people, the quality of our product, and the strength of our performance. We are seeking talented, motivated people to help us create the next generation of U. S. Steel, known for consistently out-performing the competition, delivering superior returns, and creating value for our customers as a world-class supplier of innovative steel products and solutions.

Preferred Skills

In addition, a successful intern will have:

  • A strong record of team, project and/or people leadership in a work setting and/or extracurricular activities
  • A willingness to take initiative to understand the business
  • An aptitude for problem solving; strong writing and verbal communication skills
  • A strong commitment to excellence and to personal and professional growth
  • Must be resourceful, responsible, tenacious, curious, independent, confident and high energy
  • The ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.
  • Leadership and strong decision-making skills
  • Ability to think and act both strategically and tactically

Job Category

Student Employment

Competency Summary

Think: Think Critically and Drive Change
Lead: Develop Talent and Collaborate
Do: Empower Performance and Deliver Results

Equal Employment Opportunity

U. S. Steel is a principled company committed to its core values of safety, diversity & inclusion, environmental stewardship, results focus & accountability. We focus on our customers, driving quality and ensuring cost effectiveness. We promote an environment of respect, transparency and collaboration – encouraging new ideas that drive innovation and our collective success. U. S. Steel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Overview:

Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in.

Before there were smartphones or smart cities, before autonomous cars or 360° virtual reality videos, there was our technology. Headquartered in San Diego, for over 30 years Qualcomm inventions have inspired others to make the impossible, possible. From 5G to artificial intelligence, from IoT to automotive and extended reality applications, Qualcomm is inventing the technologies of an intelligently connected future, spearheading research efforts for the next global wireless standard, and collaborating with industry leaders in the wireless value chain to make this future a commercial reality.

As a Qualcomm Campus Team I ntern , you will be responsible for the technical aspects of our summer program. This includes building out websites, highlighting Qualcomm Technologies, and hosting our summer online hackathon.

Minimum Qualification:

  • Academic and/ or project experience in web development

  • Knowledge of hackathons

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Academic and/ or project experience in building Sharepoint websites

  • Knowledge of HTML/CSS, Python, Php

Educational Requirements:

  • In study towards a bachelors in computer science, engineering, or a related field

  • Must be available for 10 – 16 weeks during Summer 2021 (May-September) with a graduation date of December 2021 or later

Working at Qualcomm may be the closest you’ll get to experiencing time travel. You won’t just work in a lab or write lines of code. Our interns join world-class teams to help define and build what is next for mobility and the world.

You’ll be paired with a mentor with visibility to your project and team, receive support from your manager and have access to the entire Qualcomm employee community to ensure your success.

In addition to competitive pay and accrued vacation time, you will receive full relocation coverage and furnished housing accommodations for the duration of your internship

We’ll make sure you have fun outside of work with weekend surf lessons & beach days, networking opportunities with Qualcomm executives and professionals, company-wide mentorship program platform, overnight hackathon, community service opportunities, and so much more...

Whether you're graduating and seeking a full-time position after your internship, or hoping to return for another internship the following year, you will be considered for a returning offer through an evaluation of your work from the summer.

*Certain program offerings are only available in certain office locations or to those who qualify based on pre-determined criteria. Specific benefits provided for given roles and locations will be detailed at the time of offer.

All Qualcomm employees are expected to actively support diversity on their teams, and in the Company.

Company Profile:

Management Systems International (MSI), a Tetra Tech Company, is a Washington, D.C. metro area management consultancy with a 40-year history of delivering results for our clients. Our expertise is in the fields of monitoring and evaluation; democracy and governance; peace and stability; rule of law and accountability; education; gender and inclusion; strategic communications; and leadership and organizational development. MSI has implemented projects in 90 countries around the world such as Afghanistan, Colombia, Indonesia, Jordan, Kenya, Mexico, Nigeria, Pakistan, Syria and Ukraine, and works domestically. We support clients ranging from the U.S. Government (e.g., the U.S. Agency for International Development, U.S. Department of Defense, U.S. Departments of State and Labor, and the Millennium Challenge Corporation) to large bilateral and multilateral donors (e.g., the World Bank and the United Nations Development Program). We also work with national and local governments, nongovernmental organizations (NGOs), think tanks, foundations and universities. For more information, please visit our website at www.msiworldwide.com.

Position Summary:

MSI is now accepting applications for an internship to help our Chevron five year "Bangladesh Partnership Initiative" (BPI). The position will last approximately three months, with the possibility for extension based on performance, how well the candidate works with the team, and the needs of the team. Internships require a commitment of 28 hours per week. Applicants residing or attending school in the D.C. Metropolitan area are preferred. This is a paid position.

The Bangladesh Partnership Initiative

In 2014, Chevron launched the five-year “Bangladesh Partnership Initiative” (BPI) to complement and maximize the impact of its existing economic development and social investment programs. The goal of the project is to sustainably improve the livelihoods, employability, incomes, and inclusiveness of communities near Chevron’s operations in Greater Sylhet in the districts of Sylhet, Moulvibazar, and Hobiganj. BPI is currently comprised of two projects — “Jibika II,” an enterprise development and access to finance project, the latter of which is being implemented by BRAC and its partner, Institute of Development Affairs (IDEA), and “Uttoron,” a workforce development program being carried out by Swisscontact. Chevron has contracted with MSI to collect monthly monitoring data on village development organizations’ operations, finances, and outcomes.

Responsibilities:

The intern’s primary responsibility would be to help engineer a workflow process starting with a collection of Excel worksheets and workbooks, leading to a collection of cleaned and merged data files which are then processed into multiple indicator tables and visualizations displayed in a static dashboard. Further development may include display in an interactive dashboard. ​

Qualifications:

  • Masters degree student in any quantitative social science (economics, epidemiology, sociology) or explicitly an analytics field such as data science, operations research, information technology, computer science, etc.
  • High abilities with R programming language, including use of R for automation of data handling, static or interactive dashboards, and hosting active web pages.
  • Abilities with Git for hosting, version control, and reproducible research
  • Professional demeanor and diplomatic communication skills, especially via email.
  • Attention to detail and ability to prioritize within a multi-tasking environment.
  • Excellent writing/editing skills.
  • Strong organizational skills.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and the ability to learn new software programs quickly.
  • Fluency in a second language, preferably Arabic, French or Spanish preferred

Only candidates who have been selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

MSI is an EEO/AA/ADA Veterans Employer.

Reasonable Accommodations: MSI is dedicated to hiring an inclusive workforce. If you would like to request reasonable accommodations during the application process, please email MSI.Dept.HRRecruiting@ tetratechinc.onmicrosoft.com with “Reasonable Accommodations” in the title. Our recruitment team looks forward to engaging in an interactive process to provide reasonable accommodations for candidates.

To apply: Please visit our website, www.msiworldwide.com

Jersey City, NJ, USA Req #104

Wednesday, June 9, 2021

Fortitude Re is a liability-led reinsurer of legacy insurance portfolios complemented by sophisticated investment capabilities. In 2016, AIG created a “Legacy” portfolio as a separate non-core segment representing insurance reserves associated with discontinued lines of commercial Property & Casualty and Life & Annuity insurance businesses. The following year, AIG formed a Bermuda-domiciled composite reinsurer, now Fortitude Re, to house the Legacy portfolio in a separate, distinct, well-capitalized balance sheet with a dedicated management team. In 2018, the company entered into a series of L&A and P&C reinsurance transactions with AIG and received an initial capitalization of ~$3 BN. The transactions represented ~$37 BN of reserves supported by ~$40 BN of invested assets. During this time, AIG also entered into a long-term partnership with The Carlyle Group, with Carlyle acquiring 19.9 % ownership. Then in 2019, The Carlyle Group and T&D announced acquisition of majority interest in Fortitude Re from AIG. This allowed for a new long-term shareholder base for the company while maintaining a strong capital position for supporting reinsurance obligations. Click here for more information about Fortitude Re.

Position Summary

  • Strong time management and organizational skills.
  • Possess strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to present ideas and information to team, leaders, and peers.

position: Data Analyst Intern - McKinsey Global Institute (12 months)
description:
Qualifications

  • Experience/exposure to SQL language, Python, Cloud Environments is a plus
  • Passion for research and data analytics particularly in economics topics
  • Proficiency in Excel, Alteryx, Tableau or other ETL related software
  • Superb people skills and strong team orientation
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines

Who You'll Work With

You'll join our San Jose office as part of our Client Capabilities Network for the McKinsey Global Institute. You will assist in a variety of projects in support of our data platform.
Colleagues in our global Client Capabilities Networkdeliver distinctive client impact through assets and expertise and are driven by a culture of innovation.
McKinsey & Company established the McKinsey Global Institute in 1990 as its independent, internal economics research arm. Its mission is two-fold: to achieve breakthrough microeconomic understanding of the most important global macroeconomic issues today, and to generate insights that materially impact the decisions of both corporate leaders and policymakers.

What You'll Do

You will split your time between content development and knowledge management activities in several long-term research investments.

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. We encompass the best of both worlds – a team of dedicated professionals with years of experience, who are also at the forefront of an industry taking over the entertainment landscape. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. Starting with Blood, our very first title – all the way to our most recent offering, Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, we are constantly pushing the envelope to combine innovative gameplay, inventive narratives, cutting edge tech & AI, and stunning visuals. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. That’s where you come in – for us to achieve that we need the best and brightest talent the industry has to offer. Come join us and help create our next AAA title! The studio is utilizing its extensive expertise in creating persistent online worlds that foster powerful social gaming communities to develop its mobile titles, which include Batman™: Arkham Underworld and the upcoming Game of Thrones® mobile game. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!

The Job

Company Description


Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.


Job Description


Square's Hardware Team builds the tangible connection to Square. We started with a simple Reader that turns any phone or tablet into a mobile point of sale - and we continue to lead this category with advances in technologies that define point of sale hardware (NFC, display, WiFi, Bluetooth, touch). Our hardware engineers design and develop outstanding hardware products. They understand the subtleties of user interaction, robust communication interfaces, and smart product design.

For this 12-week remote internship, you will:

  • Become intimately familiar with Square's hardware products and manufacturing processes.
  • Research technologies for our next-generation hardware products.
  • As part of the Systems Engineering track, you will develop device characterization plans and measurement-setup prototypes for new technologies.
  • As part of the Electrical Design Engineering track, you will help design and test electrical systems for new Square hardware products
  • Work with Square's Devices Software Engineering group to understand embedded test access and APIs.
  • Write and debug engineering automation software for the lab and the factory.
  • Reach beyond boundaries to make Square's products better wherever you see the chance

Qualifications


You are:

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field, graduating between May 2022 and June 2024.
  • Familiar with Python, MATLAB, or similar programming language
  • Experience with EE schematics and PCB layout
  • EE skills including switch mode power supplies, amplifiers, microcontrollers, batteries and charging systems, and high speed digital signals.
  • Familiar with hardware lab equipment for test, measurement (e.g. oscilloscope, power supply, function generator, spectrum analyzer, DMM), or prototyping (Soldering, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, 3D printing, powertools)
  • Excited to work on hands-on projects and to make things work in EE or software realms
  • Eager to apply engineering skills to dig into challenges that are outside of your expertise.
  • You're collaborative and excited to work as part of a team, ask questions, and share information to solve problems.

Even better:

  • Experience measurement systems automation.
  • Knowledgeable of statistics
  • Familiar with the co-existence of multiple technologies in a unified system.
  • Experience with Altium Schematic and PCB design tools

Additional Information


At Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

position: 2022 Trading and Portfolio Finance Summer Analyst
description:
AQR Capital Management

AQR is a global investment firm built at the intersection of financial theory and practical application. We strive to deliver concrete, long-term results by looking past market noise to identify and isolate the factors that matter most, and by developing ideas that stand up to rigorous testing. By putting theory into practice, we have become a leader in alternative strategies and an innovator in traditional portfolio management since 1998.

At AQR, our employees share a common spirit of academic excellence, intellectual honesty and an unwavering commitment to seeking the truth. We're determined to know what makes financial markets tick – and we'll ask every question and challenge every assumption. We recognize and respect the power of collaboration and believe transparency and openness to new ideas leads to innovation.

The Internship Program

Our 10-week summer program puts real work of the firm in your hands. You will work alongside brilliant people, gain insights and know-how from our Quanta Academy Summer Term curriculum, and experience what it's like to work at the pinnacle of global, systematic investing.

Learning is the cornerstone of our culture and plays an active role in the internship experience — through daily collaboration and interaction with employees at all levels, in workshops and classes, and most significantly by working on projects that matter to the many clients we serve. Our unique AQR Quanta Academy: Summer Term learning series, a structured program, consists of over 40 hours of educational, skill-building and networking events.

The Team

The Trading and Financing team is responsible for efficient trade execution of AQR's investment strategies. The team is comprised of traders, trading assistants, trading infrastructure and trading algorithm developers as well as market microstructure and short-term signal researchers. The department:

Is Responsible for all the firm's global trading on exchanges, SEFs and OTC markets

Develops and evaluates algorithmic trading methodologies in many asset classes

Performs transaction cost analysis in markets that the firm transacts in and builds cost forecasting models for use in AQR's investment strategies

Assists Portfolio Implementation and Research Teams in the management of portfolios and the refinement of the investment process

The Portfolio Finance team consists of highly dynamic and multi-faceted professionals with extensive experience at both buy-side and sell-side firms. As one of the most recently formed and actively growing departments at AQR, Portfolio Finance has three primary responsibilities:

Optimizing the traditional and synthetic financing utilization of the firm across all the breath of asset classes traded by the firm, including associated collateral requirements, instrument types (i.e., derivatives or securities), and investment strategies

Investing and portfolio management of domestic and foreign, cash and cash-equivalent instruments

Managing AQR's critical relationships and numerous touchpoints with the largest firms on Wall Street.

Your Role

We are seeking exceptionally talented individuals to join our Trading and Financing team as interns. Candidates should be ambitious and enthusiastic about implementing new ideas, working within the trading desk and with others in the firm to enhance current processes as a self-starter. Interns will experience a 10-week rotational program throughout functions of the team. Interns will fully immerse in the daily functions of high touch and electronic execution trading, portfolio finance, business management and trade support teams. A rotation through some subset of these functions is planned in order to expose the candidate to multiple functions of the team. You will work in a collaborative environment and on an individual capstone project throughout the summer. Mentorship and constructive performance review will be a focus throughout your time as you work towards earning a full-time role.

What You'll Bring

December 2022 or Winter/Spring 2023 graduate in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, Engineering, or scientific related field

Well-organized, detail-oriented, and strong verbal and written communication skills

Hard-working and eager to learn in a highly intellectual, collaborative environment

Demonstrated interest in finance, economics, and capital markets

Strong technical/quantitative skills

Computer science/programming skills preferred

AQR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. EEO/VET/DISABILITY

Overview:
UW Credit Union has a great opportunity for an individual aspiring to pursue a career in the information technology field. The IT Desktop Support Intern will be used to augment the IT End User Services staff. The IT Desktop Support Intern will primarily be responsible for assisting the IT End User Services team with receiving, preparing, and deploying client devices, such as laptops, desktop computers, monitors, and other peripheral devices. This may include installing and testing computer equipment, relocating hardware, and hands-on troubleshooting. This person will also be supporting various department projects and activities.

position: Intern - Planning and Zoning - Baldwin County Commission
description:
Position Description


The Baldwin County Commission (subsequently referred to as “the County”) is seeking a temporary Planning intern. This internship will be for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

Job Description:
The primary function of the intern is to provide administrative and customer service functions to support the Planning and Zoning Department. The intern will be responsible for providing customer service, researching and updating data, and performing basic zoning/subdivision research for the department.

Essential Job Functions

  • Responds to inquiries and provides assistance to County staff and the public, by telephone, email and in person, regarding zoning and related planning information;
  • Assists planners and planning techs with reviewing plans for compliance with zoning/subdivision standards;
  • Assists planners with planning/subdivision related research;
  • Maintains and updates information in Citizenserve;
  • Participating in and/or managing special planning projects under the supervision of Planners
  • Assists in the preparation of address mailing lists for planning applications;
  • Creates, updates, and maintains spreadsheets, reports, and databases from established content; verifies and tabulates data; run basic reports and queries as requested;
  • Data collection and field assessments
  • Creates and maintains records, related correspondence and documents;
  • Performs a variety of clerical and administrative support tasks for the Department;
  • Performs all work duties and activities in accordance with County’s policies and procedures

Education and Experience

  • Computer programs; Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Preference given for applicants with background in GIS.
  • General office procedures; answering phones, copying, filing. Be able to follow direction as well as take self-initiative, must be courteous, polite and enjoy meeting and talking with people both in-person and on the phone.
  • Preference for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

at Rivian Automotive

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

The Safeguard IT Business Enablement team is focused on delivering efficient and effective technology solutions and leading technology enablement programs across all of Safeguard Medical. Responsibilities will be focused on engaging customers to assist in the adoption of new technologies and assist with tool/user administration and management. Frequent use of audio and video technology is required to engage with users at all functional level around the globe.

position: College to Corporate Internship - Investment Management - PA
description:
Drive superior investment results

Why join Vanguard’s College to Corporate Internship Program for Investment Management? You will experience buy-side investing with a leading-edge investment management organization. Your internship will provide an opportunity to collaborate alongside a team of premier investment professionals and influence the investment outcomes of over thirty million clients. Through hands-on involvement with the global investment ecosystem and equipped with the tools and resources to succeed, you’ll learn how these elements shape the financial future of our clients and of Vanguard itself. Make it count!


In this internship program:

  • Pursue an assignment within one of Vanguard's investment teams including Fixed Income Group (FIG), Equity Index Group (EIG), Quantitative Equity Group (QEG), Investment Strategy Group (ISG), Portfolio Review Department (PRD), Investment Management FinTech Strategies (IMFS), or Risk Management Group (RMG). You will work in a department that draws upon your experiences and interests as well as meets our business needs
  • Experience an intensive, comprehensive approach to investing that employs a range of strategies across asset classes, expanding your expertise while developing a broad understanding of our business
  • Smaller cadre sizes which support opportunities for focused learning, individualized feedback, and close community connections
  • Collaborate with others and lead a project distilling complex data to uncover insights that you will present to leadership – influencing decisions that directly affect investors
  • Meet regularly with your department manager, internship program manager, and key business leaders. Receive personalized coaching and mentorship
  • Cultivate new relationships in a stimulating network of dedicated professionals working to do what’s right for the investor
  • Make a positive impact on investors and the global financial markets as a whole through your increased knowledge of Vanguard’s mission driven investment philosophy

Lead the future of investing

  • At Vanguard, we value community, camaraderie, and leaders who are adaptable and independent-minded. Your upbeat work ethic, leadership and communication abilities will be invaluable as we advance our mission to make investment success accessible to everyone. Strong analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and conceptual creativity will help further your expertise in investments and products in a dynamic internship program, preparing for a career in investment management. Here, you’ll make your internship count as you advance Vanguard’s mission.
  • Upon successful completion of the program, you will have the opportunity to apply for a full-time position, including one of the Vanguard rotational programs. These opportunities are designed to provide a broad work-training experience prior to launching into your specific role.

What it takes

  • Cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher preferred.
  • Majors in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Math, Accounting, Engineering, or Computer Science preferred
  • Effective communication, analytical, leadership, and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Adaptability, the ability to learn quickly, and take initiative
  • Passion for Investment Management
  • Results-oriented with the ability to lead multiple priorities
  • Strong technical acumen a plus, including data analytical, statistical, and programming (preferably Python) skills
  • A commitment to strengthening communities by donating your time and talent

Special Factors

  • At this time Vanguard is only considering candidates that will not now, or in the future, need sponsorship or other immigration support to obtain US work authorization
  • This program is a full-time, paid summer internship
  • The start date for this program will be May/June 2022
  • Acceptance into the program is contingent upon a successful drug-screening result

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Mechanical Engineer Intern-TUC01066

Description

BOMBARDIER

At Bombardier, our employees work together to evolve mobility worldwide - one good idea at a time. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.

With an average of over 300 sunny days per year, Bombardier Business Aircraft’s Tucson Service Center is surrounded by stunning mountain ranges and desert landscapes. Celebrating over 40 years of operations in Tucson, Arizona, the service center occupies almost 1 million sq ft of total hangar space and is the largest of Bombardier’s nine aircraft service centers. The facility services both Bombardier commercial and business aircraft. Since its inauguration in 1976, the facility has been located at Tucson International Airport, a strategic location and a key local partner. The 247,000 sq ft Business Aircraft facility is equipped to perform scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, modifications, including interior modifications, avionics installations, customized exterior paint, and Aircraft on Ground (AOG) support for Bombardier Learjet, Challenger and Global aircraft. The Service Center has received certifications from CAAC, FAA, EASA, Argentina (Military), Bermuda, Canada, Cayman Islands, Hong Kong, India, Mexico, Qatar and South Africa.

Bombardier has an exciting opportunity available for a Mechanical Engineer Intern based in Tucson, AZ.

In your role, you will:

  • Assist with interpreting customer specifications, vendor requirements, company/industry standards, FAA/DOT and foreign regulations
  • Assist with determining mechanical equipment, hardware, antenna and system requirements in all types of Bombardier aircraft
  • Assist with investigating design build issues and help develop structural engineering solutions
  • Release temporary engineering to resolve build issues in a timely manner
  • Assist in dispositioning aircraft non-conformances including rework instructions
  • Perform aircraft and engineering drawing investigation and coordination with affected engineering disciplines, Quality assurance and operations manufacturing representatives
  • Coordinate with vendors to resolve installation interface and reliability problems
  • Author engineering to define structural special instructions or restrictions

Ramp is building the modern financial stack that enables companies to accelerate growth without compromising on their finances. We’re on a mission to uncover and eliminate waste before it undermines our customer’s goals. We make financial rigor easy by enabling real-time visibility and understanding of every dollar spent.

Ramp was founded by the same team who built, scaled, and sold Paribus to Capital One, enabling automated savings on online purchases and putting over $100 million back in consumers’ pockets every year. We are backed by Founders Fund, Coatue, and Box Group, as well as over 50 founders of leading companies.

About the Role

Ramp is, at its core, an engineering company, and is on a mission to build the best engineering team in NYC! We are looking for frontend and full stack engineering interns (12 weeks) who are excited to be part of our early story and help us build a diverse and vibrant tech community in the city. We hire engineers with a broad set of technical skills, who are highly cross-functional, and eager to solve a wide range of engineering challenges. Our ideal candidate has a strong sense of ownership and enjoys owning projects from inception to scaling it in production. We value people who take pride in their work, and show an aptitude for learning quickly whether they’re familiar with our stack or not. As an early employee, you'll be working with a nimble team of committed and talented engineers and having a large, long-term impact on technical design and engineering culture.

What You'll Do

  • Build performant, beautiful, and usable interfaces that solve for growing businesses with complex needs
  • Ship products and services in cross-functional teams
  • Work with sales and business teams to incorporate and productize customer feedback
  • Help establish engineering process, tools, and systems that will allow us to scale the code base, productivity, and the team

What You'll Need

  • Currently pursuing a B.S. (or higher) in Computer Science or a related technical field, with an expected graduation date in 2021 or 2022
  • Proficiency in Javascript, with a knack for getting the visuals right
  • Experience with one or more object-oriented programming languages
  • Track record of shipping high quality products and features or a portfolio of side projects
  • Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions
  • Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft
  • Alignment with Ramp’s core values of enabling businesses to grow more by spending less

Nice to Haves

  • Proficiency in React v16+
  • Familiarity with or desire to learn our tech stack which includes, but not limited to: Flask (Python), Elixir, AWS, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL
  • Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology

About Our Teams

  • Card Engineering | Ramp’s Card Engineering team is responsible for shipping products with a singular focus on enhancing the finance team and cardholder experience. Current project areas include accounting, physical/virtual card management, mobile wallets, transactions, reimbursements, spend insights, and vendor/invoice management.
  • Risk Engineering | Ramp’s Risk Engineering team is pioneering how risk is evaluated and building the infrastructure to scale to millions of business in the United States. Current project areas include application processing, underwriting & KYC, risk data signals, risk limit & exposure management, bank linking, capital markets, fraud, and payments.

Learn more about our problem space and environment at our new engineering blog!

Ramp Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO
  • WFH stipend to support your home office needs
  • Monthly wellness stipend

Applecart is a high growth marketing technology company based in New York City, founded in 2013. Applecart has developed a proprietary social graph platform that uses publicly available data to map over 25 billion social relationships between more than 250 million adult Americans. Applecart's platform helps major corporations, national nonprofit organizations, and high-profile political campaigns with their highest stakes marketing challenge: reaching hard-to-reach audiences of decision makers, spanning corporate executives, legislators, regulators, investors, members of the media, and more.

For years, marketing technology businesses have focused on solving b2c (consumer) marketing challenges (e.g. look-a-like modeling to find new customers), but the traditional pay-per-impression advertising model has left a massive opportunity unsolved for: how to market when a company's target isn't the average consumer, but is instead a single, senior decision maker. Applecart is the solution to this problem for some of the world's most prominent organizations.

Quick facts about us:
Applecart has generated over $30M in revenue, with annual revenues in excess of $10M.

Our senior leadership team includes two members of the 2021 Forbes 30 under 30 list for Marketing and Advertising, a former senior White House advisor, one of the earliest sales leaders at Google and Twitter, and two of the Democratic Party's most successful pollsters and strategists

Our investors include global sports, entertainment and marketing giant Endeavor, KKR Co-Chairman and Co-CEO Henry Kravis, entrepreneur Chris Burch, a founder of Palantir, senior engineering leaders at Twitter and Yelp, past CEOs of Fortune 50 companies and a number of well-known venture capitalists. Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel is a board member of the company.

Current and past clients include Blackstone, Boeing, KKR, the Environmental Defense Fund, the Business Roundtable, Governor John Kasich, Congressman Conor Lamb and Republican Voters Against Trump.

Our work has been featured on Morning Joe on MSNBC, Bloomberg and The Colbert Report, and in Axios, BusinessWeek, the Associated Press, Forbes, the Washington Post, and Politico, among many others.

About the Role

We are looking for creative, self-motivated, flexible thinkers to join our team as a Data Analyst Intern . Working with Applecart's political strategists, data analysts, and data scientists, the Data Analyst Fellow will contribute to targeting, analytics, and polling efforts on behalf of some of the country's most prominent trade associations, political campaigns, non-profits, independent expenditure efforts, and corporations.

About the Role

We are looking for creative, self-motivated, flexible thinkers to join our rapidly growing start-up as an Analyst Intern. Working with Applecart's political strategists, data analysts, and data scientists, you will assume meaningful responsibilities to help meet client needs, execute on their own research projects, and play a large role in helping our clients win campaigns.

What You Will Do

Assist in general, ongoing campaign activities
Explore Applecart's current and past projects to produce analyses and associated learnings
Build insight-rich reports for both our clients and internally within the company
Draft political polls to effectively measure public opinion about specific issues or candidates
Assist in the development of proposal and pitch materials for prospective clients
Build case studies of current and past campaign successes
Research developments in political news, political science (including research into political candidates, the histories of certain political geographies, and the academic literature of modern political campaigns), and political polling
Develop your technical skills and gain a deeper understanding of statistics

Education and Experience

You are currently enrolled in, or a recent graduate from, a BA/BS or MA/MS program at a four-year college or university in political science, public policy, statistics, computer science, economics, or a related field
You have previously worked on a small team and successfully completed time-sensitive, detail-oriented projects

Qualifications

You work well with a small team in a fast-paced, self-motivated environment
You have exceptionally strong written and verbal communication skills
You maintain a particularly sharp attention to detail
You are comfortable and confident in problem-solving as a team and autonomously
You have a passion for American politics and an interest in the nuts and bolts of political campaigns; self-proclaimed political junkies welcome!

You are open to working with solutions-oriented candidates and causes on both sides of the political aisle
You want to understand and execute using data-driven decision making

Preferred Qualifications

You have worked on a political campaign or conducted political research
You have quantitative work experience
You are familiar with a programming language; SQL and/or Python a plus

Logistical Details

Internship terms: Summer or Fall 202
This is a paid internship program

Buildertrend is looking for a UX Research Intern who will help elevate the practice of research with creative but rigorous qualitative, quantitative, and/or design research methods. The right candidate will be an effective communicator, passionate about understanding people, curious about the relationship between data, technology and society, comfortable in a flat, fast-moving organization, and a great collaborator. You will help with large research projects (generative and evaluative) and support the research efforts of the larger product team of designers, product analysts, and developers.

  • Schedule, conduct, and document research interviews to learn more about our customers and how to best improve their experiences
  • Conduct research studies by applying methods such as usability testing, interviews, field research, surveys, and diary studies
  • Design and execute studies that address both user behavior and attitudes, using the right methodology for the right questions
  • Work closely with product teams, as well as other researchers, to identify important research questions
  • Generate insights that shape how product teams think about medium and long-term product strategy
  • Work cross-functionally with design, product, data science, content strategy, engineering, and marketing
  • Combining qualitative and quantitative customer insights to generate strategic and tactical insights along with actionable recommendations
  • Communicate insights in creative and compelling ways
  • Comfort with utilizing data to define and support hypotheses


Minimum Qualification


  • Current junior, senior, or graduate student in a human behavior-related field, such as Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Communication, Anthropology, Information Science, Computer Science, Political Science, or Design
  • Knowledge of research methods in at least one subset of methods (e.g., survey design and quantitative data analysis, ethnography) - qualitative and/or quantitative research (Preferred)
  • Analytical, project management, and problem-solving experience
  • Experience with autonomy and independent decision making to weigh tradeoffs and balance demands
  • Experience with Excel (and the ability to quickly learn new tools)
  • Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

description:

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:

1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team:
The Supply Chain Collaboration team is one of the fastest growing teams within the SAP Business Network, the largest business-to-business network in the world with over 3.6 million connected companies in over 190 countries. Our solution enables customers to manage and run an efficient supply chain and helps them collaborate with direct materials suppliers through innovative planning and execution processes. We are looking for bright engineers who are passionate about solving complex business problems with purposeful and beautiful software and have fun while doing it.


What you’ll do:

Position Title: SAP Ariba iXp Intern – Full Stack Developer
Location: Palo Alto, CA
Expected start date to end date: June 2021 – August 2021


In this role, you’ll:
  • Have the unique opportunity to work on innovation/prototyping projects that will enhance the Supply Chain Collaboration offering
  • Design and develop pixel-perfect UI, robust APIs, and scalable microservices for the cloud
  • Gain insight in how enterprise customers manage and run their supply chain on the SAP Business Network


Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Candidates must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent
  • Strong desire to revolutionize the enterprise application space by building beautiful and purposeful cloud solutions for business users
  • Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, ability to articulate technical challenges and solutions clearly
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with Angular, Microservices (Springboot), Kafka, JIRA, IntelliJ IDEA, JMeter, Jenkins, Github


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

position: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
description:
Requisition ID: 286555
Work Area: Software-Development Operations
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Project:


The SAP Internship Experience Project is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP:


  • Culture of collaboration:     Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Project in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team:


The SAP Digital Platforms team, within SAP’s Intelligence Enterprise Solutions group, is responsible for SAP.com and associated external (public-facing) digital web properties. The SAP Digital Platforms team is responsible for the development lifecycle, continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices, and overall operational support for 47 country sites globally in 23 languages.


The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is a detail-oriented, in-house services team that is constantly pushing the envelope by working within our creative and technical boundaries to encourage internal customers to build the best user-experiences and blazing-fast websites.


What you’ll do:


Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected start date to end date: June - December 2021


In this role, you’ll:


The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is looking for an Intern to assist the Speed Performance Monitoring Lead to collaborate with the design, development, and other operational leads for SAP‘s digital landscapes. Our on-going objective to improve the online responsiveness of our user-experience on desktop and mobile web browsers in support of SAP’s 2021 Mobile-First strategy.


This role is responsible for assisting in the management of SAP.com and other digital entities including communications, content and assets for various areas of the global website and digital programs. The position provides a main point of contact for assigned requests, driving projects to completion through close collaboration with core platform team members, leadership, and assigned third-party agencies to ensure efficient and timely production of a high-quality digital customer experience.


Who you are:


We're looking for a self-motivated, out-of-the-box thinker who enjoys challenges across a broad range of technology subject areas, is pursuing a career in Computer Science, Front-End Web Development, or User-Experience Design with knowledge and interest in performance and optimization, front-end development, interactive design, application performance industry, and enterprise level projects.


Responsibilities


  • Audit websites for performance, identify optimization opportunities, and present the results in the cross-functional team environment.
  • Work in a collaborative environment developing and executing against immediate and long-term incremental programs.
  • Make effective tradeoffs considering business priorities, but always with the user-experience in mind.
  • Advise web engineering teams on key technical performance and optimization considerations and best practices.
  • Work with Data/Analytics team on ensure assets are trackable for reporting and insights initiatives.
  • Profile performance of JavaScript and layouts for a multitude of devices/platforms.
  • Work with partners (e.g.: Adobe, Splunk, Google, and other third-party web services) and consulting agencies to ensure each site release or initiative delivers maximum impact to customers across all websites and data platforms.
  • Generate performance reports, competitive analysis, and benchmarks for internal partners using our best-in-class performance and optimization tool-sets.
  • Build out and report on synthetic tests with Splunk (a.k.a. Rigor) Synthetic Testing platform.
  • Build out available real-user monitoring test reports with SAP.com Development Team.
  • Analyze performance metrics and build plans for improvements with development leads.
  • Provide an unparalleled customer experience by contributing to new features and technical documentation.
  • Assist with discovering and debugging issues found on web properties.
  • Find areas we can optimistically render UI without waiting on a server response.
  • Police and standardize performance budgets, health-checks, scorecards, and KPIs directed by your main point of contact.
  • Monitor and measure complex multi-step user flows on our customers’ websites and applications using a full browser and a script recorder.
  • Track mobile and desktop experiences and performance over time using pre-determined, industry standard network connections.
  • Monitor and optimize third-party tags and identify slow and error-causing external script risks.
  • Run tests with highly customizable configurations on any device type, connection speed or viewport
  • Develop, share, and set the bar within SAP for high quality in web performance engineering.
  • Assist in the support of planning and project management.
  • Assist building internal webpages in SAP JAM, Microsoft Teams, and other wiki-based platforms for documentation and communication in support of SAP’s Speed Performance Monitoring program.
  • Help organize projects in accordance with requirements.
  • Assist with SAP.com agile ceremonies and planning.
  • Leverage tools and technology for SAP.com content and asset production.
  • Have very good communication skills and enjoy communicating challenging technical concepts.
  • Measure and A/B test site performance solutions.
  • Mentor, educate and advocate for web performance across our teams.


Qualifications


  • General knowledge of web speed performance metrics.
  • General familiarity with Internet technologies and how the web works.
  • General knowledge of industry standard web speed performance tools; e.g.: WebPageTest.org, Google Pagespeed Insights, and Google Lighthouse.
  • General to Intermediate knowledge, approx. 1-2 years, of general web technologies experience; e.g.: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Java/C#/PHP.
  • Intermediate knowledge of Google Core Web Vitals strategy and metric threshold requirements.
  • Intermediate knowledge of visual design principles and commonly used tools for optimizing visual page elements; e.g.: images and media.
  • Have the ability to read and understand code, explore new technologies, and APIs.
  • General knowledge of modern browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
  • General knowledge of project management and, issue tracking and documentation tools; e.g.: JIRA, Confluence, MS Teams, Slack, etc.
  • Proficiency with converting JSON to MS Excel for in-depth speed performance reporting.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs; including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Comfortable working with a geographically-distributed software development team.
  • Willingness to acquire new skills to meet evolving needs.
  • Passion and interest in web performance optimization to improve an website’s user-experience across all web devices, internet connection speeds, and geo-locations.
  • Exceptional organizational and planning skills and a proven ability to multi-task.
  • General knowledge of Agile methodologies.
  • General understanding of content management systems such as WordPress or Adobe AEM.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills.
  • Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy and quality.
  • Ability to prioritize effectively to manage multiple projects.
  • Experience working in a team environment as well as independently.
  • Ability to collaborate across teams globally.
  • Ability to complete tasks in a timely manner.
  • Strong desire to continually learn new technologies.


Technical Experience


A basic knowledge is required for this internship.

Intermediate expertise is required for future employment opportunities.

  • Full-stack Development
  • HTML5/CSS3
  • JavaScript
  • JavaScript Frameworks
  • jQuery
  • DevTools
  • Responsive/Adaptive Design
  • Cross-Browser Development
  • Content Management Systems
  • Testing/Debugging
  • Git/Version Control
  • Bonus Skills:
    • Solid hands-on understanding of Google Analytics, CDNs and custom HTTP headers.
    • Intermediate knowledge of advanced web performance profiling tools; e.g.: GTmetrix, Pingdom, SpeedCurve, Rigor, etc.
    • Experience optimizing React applications.
    • Knowledge of code splitting and simplification methods.


Education and Professional Experience


  • In pursuit of degree in a related field or equivalent work experience; such topics of interests are:
    • Computer Science
    • Web Performance Analytics
    • Full Stack Web Development
    • Front-End Web Development
    • User-Experience Design
    • Interactive Design and Media
    • Marketing & Business
  • Relevant experience in study or similar position managing production processes and workflow.
  • Relevant experience in study or similar position monitoring quality assurance testing environments and live production systems.


Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

position: Summer Internship - Solutions Engineer (Plano, TX or Raleigh, NC)
description:
Job Description:

We deliver global real-time communications software and network solutions to service providers, enterprises, and critical infrastructure sectors. We engage deeply with our customers, helping them modernize their networks for improved competitive positioning and business outcomes in today’s smart, always-on and data-hungry world. Our innovative, end-to-end solutions portfolio delivers unparalleled scale, performance, agility and automation and includes optical and packet networking, core to edge IP solutions, UCaaS/ CPaaS cloud offers, and leading-edge software security and analytics tools.

To learn more, visit rbbn.com

Position Title: Solutions Engineer Internship

Location: Plano, TX or Raleigh, NC

The Solutions Engineer Intern will support assigned Sales and Sales Engineering teams and will learn how to articulate both the technology and value proposition of Ribbon IP and Optical products. This intern position is a great career step for anyone interested in technical sales or sales engineering in IP or Optical fields.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Assist Sales and Sales Engineering by responding to functional and technical questions on RFIs/RFPs.

Please Note:

'All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.'

US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply.
From: Ribbon Communications

JOB
The Department of Public Social Services (DPSS) has an internship opportunity with the Research Analysis & Decision Support (RADS) Division that will allow the incumbent to gain experience assisting with ArcGIS in an applied setting. The selected candidate will have the opportunity to receive training to learn new or improve current software and programming skills using SAS, SQL, and Power B, as well as geocoding data and creating maps using ArcGIS.In addition to the minimum qualifications listed below, the most qualified candidates will possess experience with geocoding and map development, be highly motivated and able to learn quickly as well as have excellent time-management, problem-solving and organizational skills. Candidates with ArcGIS or Cartography Certificates are highly encouraged to applied. The DPSS-RADS Internship is based out of Riverside but will be a combination of both remote and in-office work with a flexible work week consisting of approximately 20 hours per week and a total anticipated internship length of 1-2 years.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Assist in developing ArcGIS training and demos for other unit staffProduce new reports in ArcGIS based on data provided by Research Specialists and provide support to other unit staff for producing reportsUpdate less than optimal ArcGIS processes and maintain current ArcGIS reports produced by the unitAssist with surveys and developing reports using SAS, SQL, or Power BI programmingAssist with data processing, analysis, program evaluation, and literature review

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Cumulative Grade Point Average: Minimum 3.0 GPA for new graduate students anticipating fall attendance, or a minimum 3.0 GPA for currently attending graduate students or recent graduates. Proof of most current unofficial/official transcript with cumulative GPA must be provided at time of application.Education: Applicants must be currently enrolled/attending school at an accredited college or university, in a Bachelor's or Master's program.Areas of Study: Public or Business Administration, Human Resources, Organizational Studies, Information Technology, Computer Science, Psychology, Sociology, other Behavioral Science, or similar.Experience, Knowledge, Abilities: Basic statistical knowledge for social sciences; Knowledge of research methods and procedures; Experience using Geographic Systems (GIS), census data and geography, demographic forecasting methods, techniques, and models; Familiarity with ArcGIS, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Stata, R, or Access.**All applicants, including alumni, are required to include a current resume and most recent unofficial/official transcript. Document(s) must be uploaded as attachments at time of application to be considered.**

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Veteran's PreferenceThe County of Riverside has a Veteran's Preference Policy. Upload a copy of your (or your spouse's) Member-4 Form DD-214 or NGB-22 indicating dates of service, and a copy of your spouse's letter of disability (if applicable) with your application. For privacy reasons, it is recommended that you remove your social security information from the document(s). A Human Resources Representative will review the materials and determine if you qualify for Veteran's Preference. Policy is available here: https://www.rivcocob.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/C-3-Veterans-Preference-Program.pdfWhat's Next?This recruitment is open to all applicants currently enrolled/attending school at an accredited college or university or who have recently graduated within the past twelve months.No late applications will be permitted and changes or alterations cannot be accepted. Resumes that include job descriptions and duties copied from the job classification will not be considered.Applications received prior to the closing date will be considered based on the information submitted. Include relevant work experience details on resume and/or application. Applicants who fail to provide information demonstrating they possess the position requirements may not be considered further in the application process.General InformationFor more information, please contact lsilva@rivco.org

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

The Job

WarnerMedia seeks an Intern for the MSC - Media Software Engineer department.

The Media Supply Chain’s Business Technology Systems team is responsible for developing an array of platforms that enable our business users to schedule features and promotional material on all WarnerMedia networks, including HBO Max. Our systems guarantee that content is scheduled within the bounds of our legal rights to utilize those programs, while also ensuring that our programs are properly promoted on our networks with the visually stunning creative marketing for which WarnerMedia is famous.

We seek an intern with experience in software design and development who is looking to gain exciting real-world software engineering experience at a thriving company. This program will have our interns work side-by-side, virtually this year, with the team’s software engineers while we develop new features and functionality for our users and business partners. They will be a contributing part of all of our team’s daily status and weekly planning meetings, along with any design and problem-solving activities the team conducts.

We frequently work in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The ideal intern for this environment will be enthusiastic and collaborative and has a sincere desire for learning and growth.

Application Deadline: Monday, June 14th



The Daily
  • Develop software in modern enterprise-class languages and development platforms and new emerging technologies as appropriate
  • Agile/Scrum process participation and process improvement
  • Capable of working in a collaborative team environment
  • Can critically evaluate code as a method of learning, and knows when and how to safely refactor code/artifact

The Essentials
  • Currently enrolled in a degree program in a Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work in a small team environment
  • Ability to work in a remote environment
  • Experience programming in Java. Experience in Node.js, Angular, AWS, Unix, SQL, MongoDB is a plus.
  • Looking for energetic and “go-getter” personalities

Internship Program
  • Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
  • Fall 2021 program dates are Sept 20th - Dec 10th 12; must be available for full program duration.
  • Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (40 hours/week) for full program duration.
  • Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
  • Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
  • This position is targeted toward upperclassmen and graduate students.

The Perks
  • Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
  • Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
  • Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
  • Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
